  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Senior Inventory Supervisor",
  "description": "Sunchi Integrated Farms is a 32 year old vision, etched in the visionary mind of leading industrialist Chief Sunday Ephraim Ezeobiora, 21 years later (in 2009) the vision was to become a reality with the establishment of physical infrastructure of what is known and seen today as the expansive SUNCHI INTEGRATED FARMS EMENE, ENUGU, a well-known Agri-brand with commercial focus on breeder stock, hatchery development (Day Old Chicks production), broilers rearing, feed milling/food processing as well soya oil refining. Sunchi Integrated Farms was fully incorporated as a limited liability company by the Nigerian Cooperate Affairs Commission on 5th December, 2013 under Nigerian Company and Allied Matters Act of 1990 obtaining Certificate of Incorporation No. RC.846601
Sunchi Integrated Farms Ltd(SIFL), an associate of E. Sunny Vespa International Companies Limited.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Senior Inventory Supervisor

Job Location:&nbsp;Emene, Enugu
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The Senior Inventory Supervisor is responsible for strategic and operational control of all inventory activities across multiple stores or warehouses.
	The role ensures inventory accuracy, optimal stock levels, compliance with internal controls, and effective supervision of inventory personnel to support uninterrupted production and operational efficiency.


Key Responsibilties
Inventory Strategy &amp; Control:


	Develop and implement inventory control procedures across all operational units.
	Set and monitor minimum, maximum, and re-order levels for raw materials, finished goods, spares, and consumables.
	Ensure high inventory accuracy through effective reconciliation and controls.
	Lead periodic stock counts (cycle counts, monthly and annual stock takes).
	Investigate and resolve inventory variances, losses, damages, and obsolescence.
	Multi-Warehouse &amp; Operations Oversight
	Coordinate inventory activities across feed mill, hatchery, oil mill, production, and finished goods warehouses (as applicable).
	Ensure standardized storage, labeling, stacking, and handling procedures company-wide.
	Enforce FIFO/FEFO principles, especially for perishable and expiry-sensitive items.
	Ensure proper receiving, issuing, and transfer of materials in line with approved documentation.


Reporting, Audit &amp; Compliance:


	Prepare and review consolidated inventory reports (daily, weekly, monthly).
	Ensure accurate maintenance of bin cards, stock ledgers, and ERP records.
	Support internal and external audits and ensure closure of audit observations.
	Enforce compliance with inventory policies, internal controls, and loss-prevention measures.


Leadership &amp; Team Management:


	Supervise and mentor Warehouse Supervisors, Storekeepers, and Warehouse Officers.
	Allocate duties, set performance targets, and evaluate staff performance.
	Train inventory personnel on best practices, system usage, and compliance requirements.
	Enforce discipline, safety, and ethical standards within the inventory function.


Cross-Functional Coordination:


	Work closely with Procurement to support accurate planning and timely replenishment.
	Coordinate with Production to ensure uninterrupted material availability.
	Liaise with Accounts for inventory valuation, reconciliations, and month-end close.
	Support Quality Assurance on material quality, expiry, and compliance issues.


Continuous Improvement &amp; Risk Management:


	Identify process gaps and implement improvements to reduce losses and inefficiencies.
	Strengthen internal controls to prevent pilferage, misuse, and stock manipulation.
	Support ERP/system enhancements and data accuracy initiatives.
	Monitor daily stock levels of raw materials, finished goods, spare parts, and consumables.
	Ensure accurate recording of all inventory transactions (receipts, issues, transfers, returns).
	Maintain minimum and maximum stock levels to avoid shortages or overstocking.
	Conduct regular physical stock counts (daily, weekly, monthly) and reconcile variances.
	Investigate and report stock discrepancies, losses, or damages promptly.


Qualification &amp; Experience


	Minimum of HND / BSc in Supply Chain Management, Accounting, Business Administration, or related discipline.
	5 - 8 years of relevant experience in inventory/store management within a manufacturing environment
	A&nbsp;Master&rsquo;s Degree would be an added advantage.
	Proven experience supervising multiple stores or inventory teams
	Strong knowledge of inventory systems, internal controls, and audit requirements
	Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and ERP/inventory management software


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their updated CV in a PDF or Word format ONLY&nbsp;to:&nbsp;emekaajunam75@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

title: Bookkeeper Job at the Vault Recruitment (TVR)
content:
The Vault Recruitment (TVR) is a fast growing recruitment firm specializing in connecting top talent with SME's and Startup organizations. Our team of experienced recruiters understands the unique needs and challenges of the modern job market and uses our extensive network and industry knowledge to find the best candidates for our clients.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Bookkeeper

Job Location: Shomolu, Lagos
Employment Type: Full Time
Work Structure: (Monday- Friday On-site)

Job Summary
     

            
    




	The Bookkeeper will be responsible for maintaining accurate financial records, monitoring cash flow, and providing weekly financial performance reports to management.
	The role supports effective financial control across the company’s operations.


Responsibilities

	HND or BSc. in Accounting, Finance, Business Administration, or a related field

	Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and accounting software (e.g., Sage, QuickBooks, or similar)
	Strong attention to detail and a high level of accuracy
	Ability to meet deadlines and work with minimal supervision
	Good communication and reporting skills.


Salary
N160,000 - N180,000 / month.
